definition: to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
shameful/ugly/disgraceful
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]

sentences.english: You have soured the naturally excellent disposition of ghosts and goblins.
sentences.chinese: 你們醜化了鬼魂和精靈的善良本性。
希望會醜化醜惡的東西。

sentences.english: He says accusations of racism are smears that he has come to expect.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲指控他爲種族主義者是對他的意圖進行醜化。
愛情是一個巨大的醜化家。

sentences.english: However, if misconducted, it will have the effect of vilifying .
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果搭配不當，就會產生醜化的效果。

sentences.english: "The radical right and the Congressional Republicans have demonized me, " he answered.
sentences.chinese: “激進的右派和國會共和黨人把我醜化了，”他答道。

sentences.english: Truth does not exist in the uglified reality.
sentences.chinese: 真理不存在於醜化了的現實裏。

sentences.english: Fifth, we must continue to create news and vilifying their leadership.
sentences.chinese: 第五，我們必須繼續創造新聞和醜化他們的領導。

sentences.english: Some Americans are making every effort to uglify China.
sentences.chinese: 一些美國人總在設法醜化中國。

sentences.english: Fifth , make news continuously to uglify their leaders .
sentences.chinese: 第五，要不斷製造新聞，醜化他們的領導人。

sentences.english: China, a peace-loving people, but you have to vilify the aggressor?
sentences.chinese: 中國，一個愛好和平的民族，卻被你們醜化爲侵略者？

sentences.english: Jesus knows that at times we are tempted to demonize our enemies.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌知道，我們有時很想醜化我們的敵人。

definition: to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to invert right and wrong
to quote out of context (idiom)
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
political position
argument/view (sometimes derogatory)
to start a rumor
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to slander/to smear/to vilify
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
personal attack
to mock/to disparage/to belittle
